Intervention: Subjects are asked to take 4 capsules of polyphenol E (200mg) per day with one meal during the duration of the study. Biomarkers are measured at inclusion and then again at presurgery, the end point of the study.
Eligibility: A definitive biopsy demonstrating primary breast cancer
• Residual breast cancer requiring additional surgical resection
Stage I, II or III disease rates
The patient has the capacity to give signed informed consent
Normal hepatic and renal function (creatinine < 1.5, transaminases < 1.5 times the upper limit of normal).
• Prior hormonal or surgical treatment for breast cancer
Liver or kidney problems that interfere with the metabolism of the study drug
Any condition that would interfere with informed consent or the ability to comply with the study protocol
Participation in another research study in the last three months
• Known malignancy at any site other than the breast
A recent consumption of green tea (5 cups or more per day, in the week before biopsy)
Allergy or intolerance to any component of green tea
Incapacity or refusal to comply with definitive surgical therapy
Results: Change in serum VEGF in breast cancer
Change in serum VEGF from baseline to post-treatment with polyphenone E.
Time frame: baseline and 4 to 6 weeks
Title of the arm/group: ECGC and breast cancer

Description of the arm/group: A single arm for a Phase II study of EGCG extract and breast cancer. Subjects are invited to take 4 capsules of polyphenol E (200mg) per day with one meal for the duration of the study.
